What’s thread safety?

  • Mechanisms and Methods to guarantee that parts of a programm, which is divided into many threads run corectly and without any unexpected side effects.
  • Scheduling and Interleaving of threads shouldn’t make a difference, and the threads can complete their work without errors and with the expected behaviour.

Race Conditions

  • The result of an operation depends on the timing and order of events in a programm
  • Special case is the Data Race where multiple parallel threads want access to a shared variable at the same time which leads to unxpected results
    Types of Race Conditions
  • Read-Modify-Write - parallel running threads change the value of a shared variable based on the previous value of the same variable example: '''java public class Main { private int number; private void incrementNumber() { number++; } private int getNumber() { return number; } public static void main(String[] args) throws InterruptedException { final Main unsafe = new Main(); for (int i = 0; i < 1000; i++) { new Thread(new Runnable() { @Override public void run() { try { Thread.sleep((int)(Math.random()*100)); } catch (Exception e) {} unsafe.incrementNumber(); } }, "T" + i).start(); } Thread.sleep(1000); System.out.println("Final number should be 1000 : " + unsafe.getNumber()); } } '''
